example.text: Our previous studies using in vitro hepatic microsomal preparations suggested that the hepatic metabolism of quinine to form the major metabolite 3-hydroxyquinine is most likely catalysed by human P450 3A (CYP3A).

example.text: Helicases not only catalyse the disruption of hydrogen boding between complementary regions of nucleic acids, but also move along nucleic acid strands in a polar fashion.
example.arg: the disruption of hydrogen boding between complementary regions of nucleic acids

example.text: DNA helicases are enzymes that catalyze the unwinding of DNA by disrupting the hydrogen bonding between paired bases as they progress along the DNA strand in a polar fashion (either 3'5' or 5'3'), and have been shown to be involved in many essential cellular processes, including replication, transcription, DNA repair and translation (for reviews see West, 1996; Bird et al., 1998; Lohman et al., 1998; Hall and Matson, 1999).

example.text: The two large virus-encoded Rep proteins (Rep78 and Rep68) catalyse the resolution of the covalently cosed AAV termini, a process that involves sequence-specific AAV DNA biding, strand-specific nicking and helicase activity under ATP consumption (Im and Muzyczka, 1990, 1992; Brister and Muzyczka, 1990, 2000).
example.arg: The two large virus-encoded Rep proteins (Rep78 and Rep68)
the resolution of the covalently cosed AAV termini

example.text: However, it is interesting to note that Rep78 and Rep68 catalyse the packaging reaction up to 1000-fold less efficiently, although they posses the entire Rep52 and Rep40 coding regions, respectively.
